entry.title: Lightning Talks - Friday evening
entry.summary:
Summary

Lightning talks from Friday evening.

Description

  • 00:00 - Intro to Lightning Talks - MC Larry Hasting
  • 01:56 - Instrumental - Matthew J Desmarais
  • 07:14 - Statvent - Christian Wyglendowski
  • 12:04 - Switchboard - Kyle Adams
  • 16:14 - hy: a lisp variant - Paul Tag
  • 20:40 - 5 packages you need to know - Łukasz Langa
  • 26:24 - The future of Linux containers - Solomon Hykes
  • 32:08 - SciPy 2013 - Andy Terrel, Anthony Scopatz
  • 35:39 - BirdFish - Preston Holmes
  • 41:20 - Julython - Robert Myers
  • 44:20 - CLDR: Common locale data repository - Martin von Löwis
  • 48:49 - Spine demo and Python port of runtime - Terry Simons

entry.title: Blending art, technology, and light, Python for interactive and real time
entry.summary:
Summary

Blinking colored lights bring out the child in all of us. Color LED lighting technology is becoming more available and affordable. Layers of hardware, lighting protocols, and effects design can make doing anything more complex than blinking these lights tricky. Come learn about LEDs how to control them with Python, and about building real-time control of physical things.
